clinical_study.brief_title: Superb Micro-vascular Imaging for Evaluation of Hepatic Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: iBEAM-Based Superb Micro-vascular Imaging for Evaluation of Hepatic Lesions

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Superb Micro-vascular Imaging (SMI) based on the iBeam platform is used to evaluate the blood supply of solid tumors. Compared with color Doppler technology, the sensitivity, accuracy and consistency of the ability of SMI to display blood flow are evaluated. Thus, the investigators will use Superb-Microvascular imaging (SMI, Toshiba, Japan) for diagnosing hepatic lesions, which enable to detect slow micro vascular flow inside the tumor

detailed_description.textblock:
To evaluate the diagnostic accuracy of SMI (primary outcome) when applying on the hepatic lesion.
Each US findings during exam for patients with hepatic lesion were recorded by radiologist.
Sample size calculation according to the primary outcome.

intervention.description: Device: Superb-Microvascular imaging Superb-Microvascular imaging: new sonographic software technique on ultrasonography to detect low-vascular flow without use of contrast media for ultrasonography

study_pop.textblock: The population consisted of patients (age:18-80 years) with visible hepatic lesion on US

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Visible hepatic lesion on US
2. Agree to participate in the study
3. Accessible follow-up imaging or pathological results
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant women
